meanings.definition: In a manner characteristic of a slave; servilely.
meanings.sent1: She followed the rules slavishly, never daring to question them.
meanings.sent2: He completed the task slavishly, without any creativity or personal touch.
meanings.sent3: The robot cleaned the house slavishly, as if programmed to do so without rest.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her job was so strong that she worked slavishly day and night.
meanings.sent5: The soldier followed orders slavishly, never deviating from the commands given.

meanings.definition: In a manner that shows excessive devotion or adherence; blindly.
meanings.sent1: She believed in the fortune teller's predictions slavishly, without any skepticism.
meanings.sent2: He supported his favorite team slavishly, attending every game and cheering loudly.
meanings.sent3: The cat followed its owner slavishly, convinced that treats were always around the corner.
meanings.sent4: The artist slavishly copied the famous painting, hoping to achieve the same success.
meanings.sent5: The fans cheered slavishly for their idol, showing unwavering support and admiration.
